messages.message: Team every time I try to digitize a txt file it says >> {"status": "ERROR", "msg": "License validation failed. Error:User=vikas.pandey does not have license to use the product=AIHUB"} Do I need to configure something?
@Rakesh @Gaurav Saini can you look into this issue?

@vp
Which env is this in - aihub.internal ?
https://aihub.instabase.com/
The patches I added for disabling licensing were deleted. Adding them again. @Rakesh are you aware if we fixed the licensing issue?
@Gaurav Saini no no
don’t add again please
I deleted them to enable billing
are you running into the same issue?
I can use the application … it might be a specific issue for @vp
So where ever we enable billing - it goes hand in hand with enabling licensing ?
yes, licensing and billing are the same in aihub environment
For me, I bought the additional credits and its successful but doesn't look like it got added. It still redirects me to buy more credits.
What is the size of the document you have?
As in, are you able to digitize?
@shaunak everything is disabled since I have zero credits.
got it, can we do a quick zoom?  I would like to see the workflow
Logged in with the gmail account, that's working fine. Let me check for @vp what's the issue.
I think we might be hitting some rate limits on Stripe
The earlier one was logged in via admin. I guess the admin account was causing the issue.
okay people, I see that now the licensing is responding, after I added another file to the project, it got digitized
```{"status": "OK", "credits_used": 162979200, "credits_available": 24837020800, "credits_allowed": 25000000000}```
:dancing-penguin:
I think it is specific to the file txt. I will ponder more and report if at all this needs attention
thanks for grouping on this one, you guys are awesome
File.txt should also work - let us know vikas if that fails.

@vp I think it is fundamentally this error: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C052YKRTJP5/p1684392165740319?thread_ts=1684336113.645379&cid=C052YKRTJP5.

Stripe is giving us rate limit errors which is why we can’t refresh your credits fast enough.  And, as a result, we are running into licensing errors.

ohh I see. I was not able to capture the network reading while intermediately refreshing the AIHub, but it is very much possible those burst of stripe API calls are internal to the module and is associated with one single call through UI at Hub
